title: Will doubling velocity double kinetic energy? - Quora

response.answer_text: Will doubling velocity double kinetic energy? Answer: Kinetic Energy(KE) =  If you have a velocity say; 3 m/sec and you double it to 6 m/sec. This will happen: 3 = 9 m/s 6 = 36 m/s As you can see 9 : 36 is 1 : 4. So, doubling you velocity will increase the KE by four times. In other words Kinetic Energy is directly proportional to the square of the velocity.

Kinetic energy is proportional to the square of velocity.  Therefore, with change in velocity, Kinetic energy varies exponentially. Hence, doubling velocity would result into:     This proves, if you double the velocity, K.E becomes 4 times its initial value.
